subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: Tesing-testing
author: Frank Sumption
full_text:
Most of my contacts seem to be in real time, but ther 's also sopmething
called sidereal time.

 F-S

On Fri, May 28, 2010 at 8:40 AM, Zack Widup <w9sz.zack@...> wrote:

>
>
> I haven't gotten any EVP that talk about current events. Once I asked what
> year it was and a feamle voice on the EVP responded "1996." It was in fact
> 2006 then.
> :-)
>
> Zack
>
>   On Fri, May 28, 2010 at 8:33 AM, Frank Sumption <
> purplealiengirl@...> wrote:
>
>>
>>
>>  Wow, sounds just like EVP, sometimes "they" talk about earthquakes, and
>> bombing, but major events are often not mentioned as well. I think all this
>> stuff is connected.
>>
>>  It's gets weirder, if you get these specific warnings, you can put the
>> though "out there", not allowing it to happen, and it seems to affect the
>> predicted event. So who is to say if a prediction was false, or it was not
>> allowed?
>>
>>  Skeptics need not chime in! I mean, I think everything functions on the
>> quantum level and we effect it, or even recreate it.
>>
>>  F-S
>>
>>   On Thu, May 27, 2010 at 4:56 PM, Fiona Broome <email@...>wrote:
>>
>>>
>>>
>>> Hi,
>>>
>>> I'm not sure.
>>>
>>> This concept has its rabid detractors and -- like so many studies -- it's
>>> in the early, wild-and-crazy "what if...?" phase.
>>>
>>> All the numbers show is that an RNG (random number generator) anomaly
>>> occurred. There's speculation that the anomalies relate to global
>>> consciousness. I'm not convinced that's the whole story.
>>>
>>> For now, scientists are taking RNG anomalies and -- once the anomalies
>>> are clear and have concluded -- data-mining backwards to associate them with
>>> world events.
>>>
>>> It's interesting what events seem linked to RNG anomalies and which
>>> events seem not to affect them. The numbers turned anomalous hours before
>>> Princess Diana's death, the 9/11 attacks, and the Asian tsunami.
>>>
>>> However, other apparently important events -- and some may argue, more
>>> important events -- don't seem to connect to RNG anomalies.
>>>
>>> Other RNG anomalies can't be linked to one event, but may relate to
>>> several.
>>>
>>> For example, the RNG sequences were anomalous at the time of the volcano
>>> eruption in Iceland. However, the timing also coincided with the Kumbh Mela
>>> in India, and the big earthquake in Qinghai China. Did one, two or all of
>>> them relate to the RNG variation... or were the RNG anomalies coincidental?
>>> (Rhetorical question.)
>>>
>>> So, I look at the May 7th RNG numbers and I see an anomaly. I'm not aware
>>> of anything in our world that correlates to that date.
>>>
>>> This may be piling wild extrapolation on top of wild extrapolation, but I
>>> speculate that these RNG anomalies aren't just about our world. They may
>>> reflect something larger.
>>>
>>> Or, the RNG anomalies may be a reaction to something far more mundane,
>>> but not yet measurable or detectable.
>>>
>>> At this point, it's too early to predict anything in June. I think I'll
>>> be watching the numbers starting about a week before the 17th.
>>>
>>> This is the kind of quirky study that intrigues me. It may amount to
>>> nothing, but my "gut feeling" is: Something useful is in those RNG studies.
>>> I just don't know what it is, yet.
>>>
>>> Cheerfully,
>>> Fiona
>>>
>>> Refs: http://noosphere.princeton.edu/
>>> http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Global_Consciousness_Project
>>> http://www.abovetopsecret.com/forum/thread119102/pg1
>>>
>>>
>>> --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com <EVP-ITC%40yahoogroups.com>, Frank
>>> Sumption <purplealiengirl@...> wrote:
>>> >
>>> > So does that mean there was a possiblity of a something event on May
>>> 7th?
>>> > Got anything for June 17th, or 22nd?
>>> >
>>> > Frank-S
>>> >
>>> > On Thu, May 27, 2010 at 1:19 PM, Fiona Broome <email@...> wrote:
>>> >
>>> ...
>>>
>>> > > Checking last year's EGG composite numbers, I see a notable drop
>>> between
>>> > > August 14th (7 spikes) and 15th (7 spikes), and the 16th (4 spikes)
>>> and the
>>> > > 17th (3 spikes).
>>> > >
>>> > > That doesn't mean anything, of course, but it's something that I
>>> check now
>>> > > & then. (I'd have a better sense of the significance if August's
>>> monthly
>>> > > graph was available, but that file is showing no data right now.)
>>> > >
>>> > > On May 7th of this year, there was a significant dip (6 spikes on the
>>> 6th,
>>> > > 2 on the 7th, then 6 on the 8th). But, it was one of three similar
>>> dips this
>>> > > month. I'm not sure that they correlate to anything geopolitical.
>>> > >
>>>
>>>
>>
